boat.name: Wren
boat.full_description:
Wren was built in 1947 by Whistocks on the river Deben. She was the first of the class built with a full width coachroof. Later on a doghouse was added giving her even more room below decks.

She was owned for many years by Percy Woodcock, a well known marine writer, and based on the south coast of England. Since the turn of the millenium Wren has returned to the east coast, kept at Walton on the Naze. She was acquired by Pete Thomas who found her in a sorry state in need of a good refit. This refit has in reallity turned out to be a rebuild. The boat has been stripped of her interior (much not original) providing access to remove and replace broken timbers. Surprisingly the majority of the copper fastenings below the waterline were in a very poor state and need refastening
boat.short_description: Wren was the first of the Whisstocks Deben four-tonner class built after the war with a full width coachroof. She was built in 1947 with a bermudan sail plan and during her restoration needed to be completely refastened under the waterline.
